job_title: Clinical Research Associate in Rancho Mirage, CA
pros: They offer tuition reimbursement (as long as your director supports what you are studying, and will work with you to accommodate a schedule to take classes), $1500 toward orthodontic care, on-site cafeteria, and have many free CEU opportunities if you know the right people and know where to look. They offer PTO and 403b retirement accounts and provide financial counselors to help too.
cons: Very bureaucratic, poor leadership, support, and direction. It really is all about "who you know". They exploit and underpay those who have yet to graduate from college (such as those with vocational training, but no degree). Hard work and hands-on experience will not get you ahead here; only a college degree of BA/BS and above. They hire those with degrees but NO experience and provide them with little training support, which makes for a very disorganized work setting and high turnover. This places the burden on the experienced staff to do a majority of the work for the same (or less) pay than their colleagues with degrees; I am sure you can imagine what kind of work environment this causes. I support continuing education but I also support equal pay for equal work. The learning curve is steep and the workload is unrealistic; I witnessed many colleagues burn out and quit. The "open-door" policy was a veil- people were afraid to ask questions or ask for help, and those who made mistakes faced punitive action. As for the patient population, they very much cater to the rich and it is sad to witness how they treat people with "not-so-good" or no insurance. It is not a diverse culture- the patient demopgraphic is mostly wealthy caucasian; the management staff demographic is not so far from this either.

job_title: Registered Nurse in Rancho Mirage, CA
pros: Hours, ease of work, gratifying patient care, lovely co-workers - especially the office manager who has been there forever.
cons:
Harassing physicians, volatile work environment, jaded work place. 

One particular physician gets away with murder (almost literally!!) & all the while the facility is aware...they let evil continue. A dosimetrist spoke up about the issue and one day he just never returned back to work - this happened to a few people during my 1 year there. Nurses were forced by this particular doctor to watch her tell off other staff. Sometimes, even the patients!!

The other doctor frequently tells off her staff then ever so bipolarish agrees with her patients when they tell her how lovely we are.

I had been with the main hospital organization for almost 12yrs but my last year there wanted to settle into a nice clinic position - get a break from the ER. At 1st I loved it...then I saw how much of a jaded dictatorship it was. 

Sadly my health was taking a hit - so much anxiety at work that it was affecting my patient care. 

I made the decision to leave all the years of benefits I had accrued and I new position I actually loved, to save my health and get away from this horribly ran facility.

Also, they did not value employee education. An LVN was encouraged not to go back to school so that she could stay in her position with us...no joke!

review_title: Hypocritical and Unconcerned with Assisting Employees or Anyone Who Cannot Help Them Financially
job_title: Registrar in Rancho Mirage, CA
pros: Good benefit package, agressively expanding, beautiful atmosphere, for those in the community who don't know better, EMC is a good "brand"
cons: Upper leadership completely unconcerned with hourly employees' welfare, pay or concerns, hypocritical in their motto (healthcare as it should be - a joke!) Only one 3% payraise during my 4 year tenure, a joke considering they start you off with nothing to begin with, employees misled to believe the Employee Assistance Program (a highly touted "benefit") will actually do anything to help them- the "Foundation" must first approve any request for assistance...THEY WON'T.

review_title: The Annenberg Center fails to value it's employees and lacks good management
job_title: in Rancho Mirage, CA
pros:
Great benefits
Many good people to work with 
Beautiful building to work out of
The mission, if followed, is excellent
cons:
Very high President/CEO turnover which led to too many unnecessary changes and new favorites hired on. 
Upper management doesn't listen to the employees. Middle-management isn't respected. 
Low morale. Too controlling. No fun.
No job security. Constant fear you will be let go even when you are giving 200%.
Too many job lay-offs in the history of the company. Employees are not valued and discarded like trash (some after 15-30 years of service).
Management has a lot to be desired.

review_title: "They smile in your face . . .the backstabbers, backstabbers."
job_title: Anonymous Employee in Rancho Mirage, CA
pros: Physical setting is beautiful. Plenty of free parking. The doctors, nurses and allied healthcare professionals seem to genuinely care about the patients. Enjoyed the responsibilities of my job.
cons: Senior management is toxic. They constantly spew forth negative gossip about employees, physicians and other managers. Genuine compliments are rare, but there are lots of fake ones. You have to sell your soul to keep your job, Secrets and deception are the cultural norm. No mutual support between business divisions. It's a constant turf battle where no one wins. You have to spend more time "covering your a@#" than doing your work.

job_title: Dietetic Intern in Rancho Mirage, CA

cons: Pre-employees must really contact on their own and work with Employer Health to get paperwork done. The dietitians didn't have a clinical manager, but that is not the fault of the medical center.
